RXD.RXD.TI: General procedure for polyaniline salt catalyzed domino tetrahydroquinoline synthesis
RXD.RXD.TXT:
General procedure: In a typical experiment, a mixture of aromatic amine (1 mmol), N-vinyl lactam (2 mmol) and PANI-I2 catalyst (14 wt.percent with respect to N-vinyl lactam) under solvent free conditions was stirred at 80 °C for 10 min. ( Scheme 1
) Then EtOAc was added to the reaction mixture, filtered and separated the catalyst. Organic layer was washed with water followed by brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and concentrated.
The crude material was purified by column chromatography using silica gel (60-120 mesh) and eluted with petroleum ether: ethyl acetate (8:2).
Isolated yield was calculated and the margins of error in these experiments are +- 1percent. All the products were characterized by 1H NMR, 13C NMR, and mass spectroscopic data and compared with the literature values [16–20]. Recyclability experiment was carried out using the separated catalyst, wherein, the separated catalyst was washed with acetone and dried in an oven for 50 °C for 2 h.

CIT.CIT.AU: Boddula, Rajender; Srinivasan, Palaniappan
Varma, P. Prabhakara; Srinivasa, Aswathnarayana; Mahadevan, Kittappa M.
Srinivasa, Aswathanarayana; Mahadevan, Kittappa M.; Hulikal, Vijaykumar

RXD.RXD.TI: General Procedure for the Synthesis of 2-Methyl-4-amino-1,2,3,4-tetrahydroquinolines.
RXD.RXD.TXT: General procedure: A mixture of the substituted anilines (1.0 mmol), N-vinyl-2-pyrrolidinone (3.0 mmol) or N-vinylcaprolactam (3.0 mmol) and IONPs (11 mg, 5 molpercent) in acetonitrile (5 mL) was heated under reflux, and the reaction progress was monitored by thin layer chromatography. After completion of the reaction, the catalyst was recovered by an external magnetic field. The residues were washed with dichloromethane and dried at 80 C. The recovered catalyst was then reused in other reactions under identical conditions. After recovering the catalyst, the solvent was removed using a reduced pressure evaporator. The residue was purified by column chromatography on a silica gel to give the product.

RXD03.RXD.RGT: iron oxide nanoparticles with Saururus chinensis (S. chinensis) leaf extract (IONPs)

CIT01.CIT.JT: Bulletin of the Korean Chemical Society
CIT01.CIT.JTS: Bulletin of the Korean Chemical Society

RXD.RXD.TI: 2.3. General procedure for P2BrABr salt-catalyzed domino tetrahydroquinoline synthesis
RXD.RXD.TXT: General procedure: A mixture of aromatic amine (2 mmol), N-vinyl lactam (1 mmol) and P2BrABr catalyst (14 wt.percent with respect to aromatic amine) under solvent-free conditions was stirred at 80 °C for a particular period of time. Ethyl acetate was added to the reaction mixture. The catalyst was separated by simple filtration. Ethyl acetate solution was washed with water, followed by brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and concentrated. The products were isolated by column chromatography using silica gel (60–120 mesh) and eluted with petroleum ether. All of the products were authenticated by 1H NMR and mass spectroscopy data [18,21,22]. The recyclability experiment was carried out using the recovered catalyst, wherein, the recovered catalyst was washed with acetone and dried in an oven at 50 °C for 10 min.

CIT.CIT.AU: Rajender, Boddula; Palaniappan, Srinivasan

) Then EtOAc was added to the reaction mixture, filtered and separated the catalyst. Organic layer was washed with water followed by brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and concentrated.
The crude material was purified by column chromatography using silica gel (60-120 mesh) and eluted with petroleum ether: ethyl acetate (8:2).
Isolated yield was calculated and the margins of error in these experiments are +- 1percent. All the products were characterized by 1H NMR, 13C NMR, and mass spectroscopic data and compared with the literature values [16–20].
